_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, L.P.

Baltimore, MD Terminal

RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, L.P. (SPM&T)  Baltimore, MD Terminal, hereafter referred to as the Facility, is a refined petroleum product storage and distribution facility in Baltimore, MD.  



The Facility handles and stores pentane and various refined products.   The Risk Management Program covers the pentane blending system including the associated piping, 1x 83,960 gallon vessel, Pentane Injection Skid, and 1x pentane truck off-loading station product connection point.  Pentane is received by truck and stored in one (1) 83,960 gallon pressurized storage vessel and subsequently injected into regular and premium gasoline lines feeding the site gasoline truck loading rack.  The pentane process has been assessed as RMP Program Level 3 and therefore meets or exceeds the accidental release and risk prevention requirements laid out in 40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D.  The Facility maintains an Emergency Action Plan and coordinates emergency response with the local LEPC and responders. 



Two requirements of this section specifically apply to operations at the Facility: 



1. Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation.



SPM&T is committed to ensuring the safe operation of the Facility, to ensure a safe workplace for employees and a safe location for neighbors in the community. SPM&T has procedures in place to prevent accidents and is committed to emergency preparedness both for the Facility and the community and coordinates with the Baltimore City LEPC and Baltimore City Fire Department.



2. Risk Management Plan - The primary function of the Facility is to act as a product storage and distribution facility.

itizen concerns by fully explaining potential hazards associated with SPM&T's operations and all steps being taken

to prevent and mitigate accidents; and

- Being a good corporate citizen in Baltimore City.



With these objectives in mind, the Risk Management Plan has been developed to provide information regarding the management of the risks associated with the flammable substance storage process. Above all, SPM&T stresses its commitment to ensuring a safe working environment for employees, visitors and the community and intends to work cooperatively with the local responders and the community to ensure continued progress.
